math_set_epsilon: Epsilon is a value used to determine whether two numbers subject to rounding error are close enough to be considered "equal". It is useful when dealing with floating point maths as it can reduce the "rounding errors" that make certain operations return values that appear incorrect or contrary to what we expect. The epsilon value will be used for all the following integer operators:

Note that setting an epsilon value of 0 will disable all rounding, and using a value of 1 will give an error.
